div.pre: 2066 Gela, 1956 Burial: c. 485 B.C. (Jenkins) Contents: c. 1076 AR. Pot hoard Rhegium: - (1) tetradr. (lion hd./calf hd.) Acragas: 410 (387) didr. Gela: 254 (251) didr. (to Jenkins 40) Zancle: 3 (2) tetradr. (Samian types) Syracuse: 31 (16) tetradr. (to Boehringer 46) 2 (2) didr. Acanthus: 2 (2+ 2 in commerce) tetradr. Athens: 166 (187) tetradr. (archaic) Disposition: Gela 870 Griffo, AIIN 1958-9, pp. 301-2 Raven, Essays Robinson, p. 48, note 1 Jenkins, Gala, pp. 20-1, 150-1, illus. The hd. was found on the site of a suburban shrine. After dispersal the major part (870 coins) was recovered. The figures given above are those of Griffo, fol- lowed by Jenkins' figures based on material on exhibition at the Gela Museum. In addition to the above types Griffo lists 1 tetradr. each of Leontini and Acragas, which are prob- ably intrusive
